intro: Felicia microcephala, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange blooms that are clustered in a rounded shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. Felicia microcephala is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance.
